description.raw:
e247b30 replaces the robonaut 2 model with the most recent version generated from https://gitlab.com/nasa-jsc-robotics/r2_description (6/29/17). Besides generating the robonaut urdf and converting it to an sdf, I made minimal changes:

1. Added an xml version tag.

2. Changed the baseplate collision mesh scale from `0.01 0.01 0.01` to `1 1 1` so that the model does not fall over.

3. Created a separate collision mesh for the base `Stanchion_Baseplate_Collision.dae` so that it sits flush with the ground.

Although the new and old models appear nearly identical (left and right respectively in the GIF below), there are many changes if you look at a diff. Even inertia parameters [have been changed](
https://gitlab.com/nasa-jsc-robotics/r2_description/commit/8d99d3e4b1dc0646f1b6c9cca4fc36a299d0e24d).

![robonaut.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/Mrn8xK7/images/1116711693-robonaut.gif)

One improvement of the updated model is that the joint limits all enclose `0.0` (the starting angles). The old model has a few joint limits that have negative upper bounds, which cause it to twitch  (see above) even when in zero gravity and not in contact with the ground plane.

  3. Created a separate collision mesh for the base Stanchion_Baseplate_Collision.dae so that it sits flush with the ground.

Although the new and old models appear nearly identical (left and right respectively in the GIF below), there are many changes if you look at a diff. Even inertia parameters have been changed.

One improvement of the updated model is that the joint limits all enclose 0.0 (the starting angles). The old model has a few joint limits that have negative upper bounds, which cause it to twitch (see above) even when in zero gravity and not in contact with the ground plane.

title: Robonaut update

summary.html:
e247b30 replaces the robonaut 2 model with the most recent version generated from https://gitlab.com/nasa-jsc-robotics/r2_description (6/29/17). Besides generating the robonaut urdf and converting it to an sdf, I made minimal changes:

  1. Added an xml version tag.

  2. Changed the baseplate collision mesh scale from 0.01 0.01 0.01 to 1 1 1 so that the model does not fall over.

  3. Created a separate collision mesh for the base Stanchion_Baseplate_Collision.dae so that it sits flush with the ground.

Although the new and old models appear nearly identical (left and right respectively in the GIF below), there are many changes if you look at a diff. Even inertia parameters have been changed.

One improvement of the updated model is that the joint limits all enclose 0.0 (the starting angles). The old model has a few joint limits that have negative upper bounds, which cause it to twitch (see above) even when in zero gravity and not in contact with the ground plane.
